target_markets.market_description: Business owners, entrepreneurs, and employees involved in negotiations
target_markets.market_size_indicators: Applies to anyone who negotiates - employees, business owners, vendors

problems_validated.problem: People get what they negotiate, not what they deserve
problems_validated.severity: High - affects all business and employment outcomes
problems_validated.market_gap: Most tactics don't actually drive the needle - need brutally effective real-world tactics

products_tools.name: $100 Million Scaling Roadmap
products_tools.use_case: Business growth guidance based on portfolio company analysis
products_tools.metrics: 200 hours of analysis across portfolio companies, 10 growth stages

business_strategies.strategy: BATNA - Best Alternative to Negotiated Agreement
business_strategies.implementation: Always have strong alternatives before negotiating. Get multiple offers, maintain other options.
business_strategies.expected_results: Significant leverage in negotiations, higher aspirations, better outcomes
business_strategies.case_study: Home buying negotiation - having existing home as alternative provides psychological power

business_strategies.strategy: Only sell when you don't want to sell
business_strategies.implementation: Build businesses that generate cash flow so you negotiate from position of strength
business_strategies.expected_results: Better deal terms and higher valuations
business_strategies.case_study: Selling Gym Launch and Prestige Labs from position of not needing to sell

problems_solutions.solution: Develop strong BATNA before any negotiation
steps: Only negotiate when you have options
problems_solutions.time_estimate: Must be done before sitting down to negotiate

mistakes_to_avoid.consequences: Leaving money and value on the table
mistakes_to_avoid.prevention: Always get multiple offers before deciding
mistakes_to_avoid.example: Even if first offer seems good, compare against other potential offers

mistakes_to_avoid.mistake: Negotiating when you need the deal
mistakes_to_avoid.consequences: Weak position, poor outcomes, like trying to win poker only by bluffing
mistakes_to_avoid.prevention: Build alternatives and negotiate from position of strength
mistakes_to_avoid.example: Having other job offers before negotiating with current employer

growth_tactics.tactic: Educational content about real-world business tactics

trends_signals.trend: Demand for real-world business tactics over theoretical knowledge
trends_signals.opportunity: Educational content that bridges theory-practice gap

actionable_quotes.quote: You get what you negotiate, not what you deserve
actionable_quotes.context: Fundamental truth about negotiations in business and life
actionable_quotes.actionability: Shift from expecting fairness to actively negotiating for outcomes

actionable_quotes.quote: You only want to sell when you don't want to sell. You want to buy when you don't want to buy
actionable_quotes.actionability: Build alternatives before entering any major negotiation
Focus on building leverage before negotiating tactics

key_statistics.statistic: London Business School study found negotiators who know their alternatives set higher aspirations and achieve better outcomes
200 hours of analysis across portfolio companies
key_statistics.context: Time invested in creating the scaling roadmap
